results.title: If you are not part of the solution...you are part of the problem
results.creator_credit: Libby Lloyd, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: Violence against women is possibly the most important, least examined and most taboo subject in our society. This film explores the beginnings of White Ribbon Day and the campaign to making it an important high profile public awareness day in Australia.

results.title: Finding me
results.creator_credit: Joy Chivers, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joy Chivers, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.description: Through years of domestic violence Joy existed in the silence of the shadows, afraid to cry out, to seek help, to seek support. Broken bones and bruises heal but the emotional scarring lasts a lifetime.

results.title: Lesson plan
results.creator_credit: Jeannine le Vaillant-Moffitt, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: I have no “me” memories of my childhood aged before 7, but many memories of my siblings. A story of memories, family, love and acceptance.

results.title: Stripped
results.creator_credit: Dinky, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US
results.brief_description: Emotional put-downs can wreak havoc on you as a person, stripping you of your independence, confidence, your mind, dignity and self-respect. It takes a long time to recover and rebuild your life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dinky, ACMI and Center for Digital Storytelling US

results.title: Rowing on the Yarra
results.brief_description: A beautifully photographed portrait of Melbourne’s busy Yarra River during the rowing season with the Hoddle Bridge and passing automobile traffic framing the background using timelapse cinematography. A nostalgic feel to the film is conveyed through the use of tinted monochrome colouring and a music soundtrack.
results.description: A beautifully photographed portrait of Melbourne’s busy Yarra River during the rowing season with the Hoddle Bridge and passing automobile traffic framing the background using timelapse cinematography. A nostalgic feel to the film is conveyed through the use of tinted monochrome colouring and a music soundtrack.

A nostalgic feel to the film is conveyed through the use of tinted monochrome colouring and a music soundtrack.

results.title: The Astronomer
results.creator_credit: Kate McCartney and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A paint-on-glass animation, “The Astronomer” is the story of an old timekeeper who, little by little, loses sense of his world. It is a quiet rumination on time, progress and disconnection, the delicate threads that forge identity and the ease with which we can be forgotten.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 2005.

results.title: A Monster's Voyage
results.creator_credit: Morag Porteous, Jeremy Parker and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A young girl and her loyal friend are on a voyage together. While they are self-sufficient and happy, nothing can stay the same forever. This artistically creative short animation expresses emotion and feeling in its story-telling and has a mythical quality of legends and folklore. Use of strong colours and hand-drawn animation.
Created as part of coursework at the Centre for Animation and Interactive Media (AIM), RMIT, 2005.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Morag Porteous, Jeremy Parker and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT

results.title: That's showbiz
results.brief_description: A hilarious comedy which details the rise and fall of a failing outback vaudeville troupe which imports an infamous city striptease, Madame Lash, to enliven their act.
